name: California Alocasia
description: Alocasia gageana 'Aurea' is a variegated form of Alocasia gageana, a terrestrial plant native to Myanmar (Burma). It belongs to the Araceae family and features upright stems (60-120 cm tall) with large, dramatic, arrow-shaped to heart-shaped, variegated leaves featuring green and yellow/gold coloration. The plant displays an upright, bushy growth habit. Many species have distinctive leaf textures - some are velvety, others have metallic or iridescent surfaces that change color with viewing angle. In its native habitat, it grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds natural beauty with its distinctive variegated foliage. It's popular among Alocasia enthusiasts for its attractive variegation.
careTips: Keep soil consistently moist but well-draining
Toxic if ingested - keep away from pets and children
Requires high humidity and consistent moisture
Dormant period in winter - reduce watering
